result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon T. VICE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
The State moves to dismiss and read in all counts.  The defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 254, 15 CF 375, 15 CF 269, 15 CM 244 and 15 CM 105.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Plea date is set for 09-16-15 at 10:00 a.m.
E-mail containing the plea agreement.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon T. VICE
Current: 2336 Roosevelt Ave., Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2015)
Prior: 2604 16th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States

This case is riding along with 15 CF 254 which is set for a settlement conference on 07-16-15 at 10:40 a.m. and a plea date on 10-09-15 at 3:00 p.m.
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon T. VICE
Current: 2604 16th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 06-11-2015)
Prior: 815 Jay Street #2, Manitowoc, WI 54220

Defendant in custody on bench warrant.  The matter is continued for a status conference on 06-25-15 at 1:30 p.m., riding along with 15 CF 254 which is set for a preliminary hearing on that day.  The $200.00 cash bail previously furnished is continued by the court and the defendant is released from custody.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

Defendant failed to appear for a hearing.
State requests warrant.
Court authorizes warrant.
Minutes.

The Court hereby orders that defendant's daily report to the Manitowoc City Police Department is changed to the Two Rivers Police Department.
Copy delivered to both City of Manitowoc and City of Two Rivers Police Departments.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-14-15 at 9:00 a.m.   Plea date is set for 06-03-15 at 10:30 a.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of theft.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-09-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $200.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, report to the Manitowoc City Police Department by 4:30 p.m. Monday through Friday and have no contact with Copp's Food Center or its premises.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
